required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Effect of Telmisartan on Blood Pressure Control of High Risk Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Effect of Telmisartan (Micardis® 80 mg/ MicardisPlus® 80/12.5 mg; 80/25 mg) on Blood Pressure and Cardiovascular Risk Factor Index in High Risk Hypertensive Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to evaluate the effect of treatment with Micardis/MicardisPlus on blood pressure and its ability to reduce different indicated cardiovascular risk scores. The study will also evaluate the current antihypertensive treatment pattern in the daily practice among the patient population at increased cardiovascular risk.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to Study End
Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure From Baseline to Study End
Evolution of the Cardiovascular Risk Factor SCORE From Baseline to Study End
primary_outcome.description: A 10 year risk of fatal cardiovascular disease (CVD) in populations at high risk. Minimum 0 percent risk to Maximum 47 percent risk. Investigator judgement of evolution of SCORE from baseline to end of study. (Positive = reduction in CV risk; Neutral = no change in CV risk; Negative = deterioration in CV risk; Missing = no data available)

primary_outcome.measure: Evolution of the Cardiovascular Risk Factor Framingham From Baseline to Study End
primary_outcome.description: 10-year risk for hard coronary heart disease (CHD) outcomes (Myocardial Infarction and coronary death), according to Framingham Heart Study, measured in percent. Low risk (10 or less CHD risk at 10 years), intermediate risk (10-20), high risk (20 or more). Investigator judgement of evolution of Framingham risk score from baseline to end of study. (Positive = reduction in CV risk; Neutral = no change in CV risk; Negative = deterioration in CV risk; Missing = no data available)

primary_outcome.measure: Evolution of the European Society of Hypertension / European Society of Cardiology (ESH/ESC) Based Cardiovascular Risk Factor From Baseline to Study End
primary_outcome.description: ESH is the European society of hypertension, and ESC is the European society of cardiology. Investigator judgement of evolution of CV risk based on ESH/ ESC criteria from baseline to end of study. (Positive = reduction in CV risk; Neutral = no change in CV risk; Negative = deterioration in CV risk; Missing = no data available)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients That Achieve Target Blood Pressure Values According to the European Society of Hypertension/European Society of Cardiology (ESH/ESC)
secondary_outcome.description: ESH/ESC a goal of treatment to be below values 130/80 mm/Hg for diabetic patients and below 140/90 mmHg for non-diabetic patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Additional Antihypertensive Treatment Pattern at Visit 3 (End of Study)
Change in Heart Rate From Baseline to Study End
Number of Participants Not Completing Study
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants discontinuing study early for given reason

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Adverse Events (AE)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- diagnosis of essential arterial hypertension (BP>140/90 mm HG or BP>130/80 mm Hg for diabetic patients)
- at least one additional cardiovascular risk factor and/or known single or multiple end organ damage and/or previous cardiovascular disease
Exclusion criteria:
- hypersensitivity to the active substance or to any of the excipients in any ACE inhibitor or angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB) available on the local market, as prescribed in the SPC
- pregnancy and lactation
- diseases involving biliary obstruction
- severe liver impairment
- severe hypertension
- malignant hypertension
- secondary hypertension
- patients age under 18 years

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Data on age available for 294 patients

measure.description: Data on heart rate available for 281 patients

measure.title: Additional antihypertensive treatment at baseline
measure.description: Participants may have taken more than one antihypertensive treatment, so the percentages will not add to 100 percent.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
